title: Zillow, M.M. LaFleur join list of corporations pledging to add at least one Black member to their board of directors
description: A group of 17 companies, including Zillow and M.M. LaFleur, has signed a pledge to add at least one Black member to their board of directors within a year.

title: How Trump's rhetoric on Kamala Harris has changed -- and why
description: In the span of just over a year and a half, President Donald Trump has gone from praising Sen. Kamala Harris' crowd sizes to saying a Harris presidency would be "an insult to our country."

title: Trump supporter died from virus. His daughter has a message for Trump
description: Kristin Urquiza, whose father was a President Trump supporter and died from coronavirus, reacts to audio recordings of President Trump in which he said he is intentionally downplaying the severity of the pandemic.

title: Trump to Bob Woodward: 'You really drank the Kool-Aid!'
description: In newly released audio, President Donald Trump is heard dismissing the idea that he has benefited from White privilege and accuses interviewer, renowned Watergate journalist, Bob Woodward, of "drinking the Kool-Aid" for raising the topic.

title: 'I'm not going to let you do this': CNN anchor spars with senator over Trump audio
description: CNN's Pamela Brown talks to Republican Sen. John Kennedy about comments made by President Donald Trump during an interview with journalist Bob Woodward in which he admitted to downplaying the threat of the coronavirus because he did not want to "create a panic."

title: Analysis: Why Trump talked to Woodward so much
description: The news is stunning: President Donald Trump told longtime reporter Bob Woodward that he "wanted to always play [the threat posed by the coronavirus] down" and "still like[d] playing it down, because I don't want to create a panic" even as the virus that has now sickened more than 6.3 million Americans and killed almost 190,000 was beginning to rage across the United States.

title: Trump-Kim 'love letters' provide window into strange relationship
Church leader who called Covid-19 'God's punishment' for same-sex marriage tests positive
White House, Trump campaign scramble to respond to revelations
description: The White House insists Donald Trump has "never lied to the American public" about coronavirus after the President gave veteran journalist Bob Woodward a series of interviews where he said the pandemic was deadly while playing it down in public.

title: 4 insane things just happened to Tesla
description: We're barely a week into September and it's already been a wild month for Tesla.

title: Teacher's creative welcome-back video lights up internet
description: Wisconsin high school teacher Paul Miller took the internet by storm for his back-to-school rendition of the "Friends" theme song.

title: Robot dogs join high-tech US Air Force exercise
description: It looked like a scene from science fiction.

title: Iconic sitcom gets one-night reboot with Black cast
description: Black actresses Tracee Ellis Ross, Regina King and Alfre Woodward re-enacted an episode of 'The Golden Girls' to raise awareness of issues before the election.

title: Fire ravages Europe's largest migrant camp
description: Europe's largest migrant camp, Moria, has been "completely destroyed" after massive fires broke out early Wednesday at the overcrowded site on Greece's Lesbos island, according to an eyewitness.

title: Fendi announces fashion titan Karl Lagerfeld's successor
description: British designer Kim Jones has been appointed the new artistic director of womenswear at the Italian fashion house Fendi, it was announced today. Known for his mix of streetwear and high fashion, Jones will also remain at the helm of Dior Men, where he has transformed the brand to appeal to younger consumers.

title: Some of the best moments from 'Keeping up with the Kardashians'
description: The end of an era draws close.

title: Strong winds topple more than 45 semitrucks in 1 day
description: Some Utah highways turned dangerous when extremely strong winds caused at least 45 semitrucks to topple within one day. At least four drivers had to receive medical treatment.

title: 'Doomsday glacier' could increase sea levels 25 inches -- and it's melting fast
description: Deep channels discovered under the Antarctic's so-called "Doomsday glacier" may be allowing warm ocean water to melt the underside of ice, according to scientists collecting data from an area crucial to understanding sea-level rise.

title: For the first time since 2014, men's tennis will have a new grand slam champion
description: In a matter of minutes Sunday, this year's US Open men's draw went from a closed book to a vast blank page.

title: Because of Covid, these female rangers could never go home
description: Packing her bags to go home for the first time in over four months, Maasai ranger Purity Lakara -- who patrols lands in Kenya's Amboseli National Park, known for its free-roaming elephants and views of Mount Kilimanjaro -- is overjoyed to be seeing her family for the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic was declared.

title: Naomi Osaka nearly moved to tears by messages from families of Ahmaud Arbery and Trayvon Martin
description: After her win Tuesday night in the quarterfinal match of the US Open, tennis star Naomi Osaka was nearly brought to tears by video messages from the parents of Trayvon Martin and Ahmaud Arbery thanking her for honoring them during the tournament.

title: How 'El Loco' saved Leeds United
description: Leeds United manager Marcelo Bielsa has brought the sleeping English giants back to the Premier League, but that's just the latest in a line of achievements for the man Pep Guardiola calls the best manager in football.

title: Black jogger detained by police and sheriff who offered him a job talks to Anderson Cooper
description: A Black jogger who went on Facebook Live when he was stopped by police joins Anderson Cooper along with the sheriff who later offered him a job. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

title: Belarusian activist forcibly removed from country by security services
Convicted murderer on death row sworn in by Sri Lankan parliament
description: A convicted murderer on death row was sworn in as a Sri Lankan lawmaker Tuesday, after a court ruled that he could not be barred from the country's 225-member Parliament.

title: In an escalating 'war or words,' US lawmakers are pushing to strip Chinese President Xi Jinping of his title
Taiwan appears determined to create an anti-Beijing alliance as Chinese state media warns of potential sanctions against US
description: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen wants to create an alliance to defend "freedom, safety, human rights and democracy" in Asia, as the self-ruled island faces renewed pressure from neighboring China.

title: Coronavirus pandemic is jeopardizing decades of work in reducing preventable childhood deaths: report
description: Preventable deaths in children under 5 were at the lowest number on record in 2019 at just over 5 million, down from 12.5 million in 1990, according to a new United Nations/ World Bank report released Tuesday.

title: Trump intensifies assault on rule of law as he fights for reelection
description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday went further than ever before in putting the degradation of the rule of law at the center of his reelection campaign.

title: Belarusian activist forcibly removed from country by security services
description: A Belarusian activist has been ejected from the eastern European country by security forces, according to a statement from the Belarusian Coordination Council.

title: CNN analyst reacts to Barr's involvement in Trump's legal issues: 'Sheer lunacy'
description: CNN analyst Elie Honig and Don Lemon discuss Attorney General Bill Barr and the Justice Department's unprecedented involvement with President Donald Trump's legal issues.

title: PUBG ditches Tencent to avoid India's ban on Chinese apps
description: The developer of PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds has cut ties with Tencent in India in a bid to skirt a government ban on Chinese mobile apps in one of the video game's most lucrative markets.

title: Analysis: Presidential voting is now happening in two states
description: Each state has different rules about voting as well as about how and when to vote by mail in this year of Covid.

title: The Oscars make inclusion a requirement for best picture
description: Five years after the #OscarsSoWhite hashtag triggered controversy, the group behind the awards has made inclusion a requirement to be considered to win them.

title: Disney hit by backlash after thanking Xinjiang authorities in 'Mulan' credits
description: Disney has publicly thanked a Chinese government agency accused of human rights abuses in Xinjiang for its help in making "Mulan" — a revelation that has provoked a storm of criticism online.

title: Trump makes false claims about Biden at rally
description: During a campaign speech in North Carolina on Tuesday, President Donald Trump spent much of his time attacking his opponent, Democratic nominee Joe Biden, with accusations that were often false or misleading.

title: DOJ wants to take over Trump's defense in a lawsuit filed by a woman who accused him of sexual assault
Oil prices are collapsing after Saudi Arabia sends ominous signal
description: Demand fears are once again rippling through the oil patch.

title: AstraZeneca pauses coronavirus vaccine trial after unexplained illness in volunteer
description: Drug giant AstraZeneca said Tuesday it had paused global trials of its coronavirus vaccine because of an unexplained illness in one of the volunteers.

title: Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine could be ready for approval by mid-October -- but there are still 'unknowns'
US Justice Department wants to defend Trump in E. Jean Carroll defamation lawsuit
Trump holds rally with few people wearing masks
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta comment on President Donald Trump holding a campaign rally in North Carolina with few people wearing masks, despite the state's mask requirement.
